item.title: 沃尔玛在线业务今年有望实现盈利
item.description: 沃尔玛公司首席财务官约翰-大卫-雷尼（John David Rainey）周三表示，该公司的美国在线业务有望在今年实现盈利。【原文：Walmart Inc.’s US online business is on track to reach profitability this year, Chief Financial Officer John David Rainey said Wednesday.】

item.title: 征收关税后亚马逊取消部分来自中国的库存订单
item.description: 据彭博社和熟悉内情的人士查阅的一份文件显示，亚马逊公司已经取消了对中国和其他亚洲国家制造的多种产品的订单，这表明该公司正在减少对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收关税的风险敞口。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. has canceled orders for multiple products made in China and other Asian countries, according to a document reviewed by Bloomberg and people familiar with the matter, suggesting the company is reducing its exposure to tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 尽管意大利经济增长受挫，但梅洛尼赤字计划仍在按计划进行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）将制定计划，表明即使经济增长低于预期，意大利明年的赤字仍有可能低于欧盟规定的 3% 的赤字上限。【原文：Premier Giorgia Meloni will lay out plans suggesting Italy’s deficit could potentially get below the European Union’s 3% deficit ceiling next year, even with the economy growing less than forecast, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.description: 加拿大最大的私营部门工会警告说，随着美国加征关税进入第二周，加拿大汽车制造商和零部件供应商的数千人临时裁员 "仅仅是个开始"。【原文：Thousands of temporary layoffs at automakers and parts suppliers in Canada are “just the start of it,” warned the country’s largest private-sector union, as the imposition of US tariffs enters its second week.】

item.title: 华尔街鲜有藏身之处，防御性交易失灵
item.description: 就在债券抛售而股票受挫的同时，一系列所谓的多元化投资策略也未能兑现其防御性的承诺。【原文：Just as bonds sell off while stocks get whipsawed, a slew of supposedly diversifying investment strategies are also failing to live up to their defensive billing.】

item.title: 特朗普在关税后表示 "冷静"，并补充说 "现在是购买的好时机
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周三敦促美国人保持冷静并继续投资，因为他的全面互惠关税措施正在实施，这表明白宫正在密切关注市场对征税的反应。【原文：President Donald Trump urged Americans to remain calm and continue investing on Wednesday as his sweeping reciprocal tariffs hit, in an indication the White House was closely monitoring market reaction to the levies.】

item.title: 亚马逊为 150 亿美元仓库扩建计划寻求合作伙伴
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，亚马逊公司正在考虑一项价值 150 亿美元的仓库扩建计划，将在美国城市和农村地区新建近 80 个物流设施，这将扭转亚马逊在大流行病后建筑业放缓的趋势。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is considering a $15 billion warehouse expansion plan for nearly 80 new logistics facilities in US cities and rural areas that would reverse its post-pandemic construction slowdown, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国监管机构关注华尔街在交易大厅使用人工智能的情况
item.description: 英国央行计划密切监控银行和对冲基金使用人工智能的情况，因为人们担心人工智能技术可能会引发市场崩溃或操纵行为，而人类甚至对此毫不知情。【原文：The Bank of England plans to closely monitor the use of artificial intelligence by banks and hedge funds over concerns that the technology could trigger a market crash or manipulation without humans even knowing about it.】

item.title: 贝森特希望与盟国达成协议，然后以集团方式处理中国问题
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，他设想与美国的盟国达成贸易协议，然后为针对中国政府的集体行动奠定基础，以解决他所描述的中国不平衡的贸易结构问题。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said he envisions reaching trade agreements with US allies that would then lay the ground for a collective approach toward Beijing to address what he described as China’s unbalanced trade structure.】

item.title: 股票下挫，做空者 6 天内获利 1590 亿美元
item.description: 在贸易战升级导致美国股市暴跌超过 10%之后，做空者（即押注股价下跌的交易商）在短短六个交易日内获得了 1,590 亿美元的纸面利润。【原文：Short sellers, or traders who wager on share price declines, are up $159 billion in paper profits over just six trading days after an escalating trade war sent the US stock market plummeting down more than 10%.】

item.title: 戴蒙称关税动荡的 "可能结果 "是经济衰退
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）表示，经济衰退是美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）关税引发的动荡的 "可能结果 "之一。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon said a recession is one “likely outcome” of the turmoil tied to President Donald Trump’s tariffs.】

item.title: 欧盟在金属争端中对 210 亿欧元美国商品征收关税
item.description: 欧盟批准对约210亿欧元（232亿美元）的美国商品征收关税，以报复唐纳德-特朗普总统上个月对欧盟钢铝出口征收25%的关税。【原文：The European Union approved tariffs to hit around €21 billion ($23.2 billion) of US goods in retaliation for the 25% duties President Donald Trump imposed last month on the bloc’s steel and aluminum exports.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利认为关税将提高降息门槛
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，考虑到关税对通胀的影响，即使经济开始恶化，央行也不太可能在关税面前降低利率。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said the central bank is less likely to lower interest rates in the face of tariffs given their inflationary impact, even if the economy begins to deteriorate.】

item.title: 墨西哥物价涨幅符合预期，为降息提供支持
item.description: 墨西哥 3 月份的年通胀率增长速度基本符合预期，这为进一步降息扫清了道路，因为美国关税有可能使墨西哥经济陷入衰退。【原文：Mexico’s annual inflation accelerated roughly in line with estimates in March, clearing the way for more interest rate cuts as US tariffs threaten to tip the economy into recession.】

item.title: 英国抵押贷款利率接近两年低点，对英国央行大幅减息的押注上升
item.description: 由于英国央行有望采取重大举措应对唐纳德-特朗普不断升级的全球关税战带来的影响，英国的抵押贷款利率已跌至近两年的低点。【原文：Mortgage rates in the UK have fallen close to a two-year low amid the prospect of a major move by the Bank of England to combat the fallout from Donald Trump’s escalating global tariff war.】

item.title: 贝森特认为债券 "正常去杠杆化"，就人民币问题警告中国
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）淡化了美国国债的抛售，称没有什么系统性问题，并警告中国不要试图通过汇率贬值来报复美国提高关税。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent played down a selloff in US Treasuries, saying that there was nothing systemic at play, and also served warning against China not to attempt to devalue its exchange rate in retaliation for American tariff hikes.】

item.title: 米莱需要大量大豆美元平息阿根廷比索暴跌
item.description: 马塞洛-切尔维尼（Marcelo Cervigni）和成千上万的阿根廷农民一样，正准备迎接一年中的头等大事：大豆收获。对于哈维尔-米莱伊总统来说，这个时机再好不过了，因为他需要大豆装运所带来的数十亿美元来抵消该国不断攀升的外汇赤字。【原文：Marcelo Cervigni, like thousands of Argentine farmers, is getting ready for the main event of the year: the soybean harvest. The timing couldn’t be better for President Javier Milei, who needs the billions of dollars that shipments fetch to offset the country’s spiraling foreign-exchange deficit.】

item.title: 谷歌将在云推送中帮助开发者制作自己的人工智能代理
item.description: 谷歌计划帮助开发者为各种任务构建人工智能助手，这可能会增加开发者对谷歌云服务的依赖和谷歌云服务的收入。【原文：Google plans to help developers build artificially intelligent assistants for a variety of tasks, which could increase dependence on — and revenue for — its cloud services.】

item.title: 航空公司和托运人趁石油暴跌锁定价格
item.description: 随着原油价格跌破每桶 60 美元，将燃料视为最大支出的消费者正急于锁定供应。【原文：With crude prices plunging below $60 a barrel, consumers who count fuel as their single biggest expense are rushing to lock in supplies.】

item.title: 欧盟贸易首脑与美国讨论降低关税的参数

item.title: 反垄断 "险象环生"，科技股风险叠加
item.description: 在大型科技公司目前面临的诸多不利因素中，一个也许是意料之外的因素继续困扰着投资者：华盛顿方面正在采取积极的反垄断姿态。【原文：Among the many headwinds facing big tech these days, a perhaps-unexpected one continues to nag at investors: an aggressive antitrust posture coming out of Washington.】

item.title: 霍尔茨曼称欧洲央行现在没有理由降息
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员罗伯特-霍尔兹曼（Robert Holzmann）表示，欧洲央行应在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对全球贸易大肆抨击所引发的不确定性消除后，再考虑进一步降息。【原文：The European Central Bank should allow uncertainty stoked by US President Donald Trump’s broadside on global trade to clear before considering any further interest-rate cuts, according to Governing Council member Robert Holzmann.】
